Text</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>Whether the number is an integer, decimal, real number or percentage.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="PercentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A percent is a value representing a fraction of one hundred, expressed as a quotient -- Usage Percent. Type is used to represent a percentage that indicates how many hundredths of a basic value are to be calculated. The result of the calculation is the proportion in percent of, e.g., amounts, values, rates, discounts, and taxes. For example, "8.25%" should be passed as "8.25", "10%" should be passed as "10" or "10.0" etc, "150%" should be passed as "150" or "150.0" etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:decimal"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="QuantityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:UniqueID>UNDT000009</ccts:UniqueID> <ccts:Acronym>CCT</ccts:Acronym> <ccts:DictionaryEntryName>Quantity. <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Schema Definition for Common Components across CSM Services</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType name="AccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type defining a reference to an Account, whether that be a Service Account, Loyalty Account or Product Stock.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ActorReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generic Actor type object used to define roles.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="AdjustmentPartsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type that supports the main body of an Adjustment business object. It supports both a direct credit or debit against an Account as well as a Balance Transfer from another Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Adjusts" type="tns:AccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Account to make the adjustment against. The sign of the Amount/Quantity is indicates whether this needs to be a Credit or Debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TransferFrom" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Account from which to transfer the Amount/Quantity from. The Amount/Quantity to transfer is held within the component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:AccountReferenceType"> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Amount to transfer from/to the Transfer Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Quantity" type="cct:QuantityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Quantity to transfer from/to the Transfer Account, if non-monetary values are required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TriggeredBy" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to another business object that triggered the Adjustment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:attribute name="businessObjectType" type="xsd:token"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of the business object being referenced, i.e. Advanced Shipment Notification or Sales Order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="AmountsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A definition of the costs associated with this feasibility request.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OneOffAmounts" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="OneOffAmount" name="RequestedDate" type="cct:DateType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the approval was requested.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CompletedDate" type="cct:DateType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the approval was completed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Outcome" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A free text description of the outcome of the approval.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ArtefactReferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="AttachmentType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="BinaryObject" type="cct:BinaryObjectType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Stores embedded base64 encoded data. Used to carry documents, images, etc. within the parent business object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Size" type="cct:MeasureType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The size in Bytes of the of the document or attachment. If this component contains the embedded data then the size is the size of the embedded data, if it is a reference without the data then it is the size of the referenced document.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Reference" type="tns:ReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to an external document.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="BusinessDayType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A business day is considered every official working day of the week. Another common term is working day. Typically, these are the days between and including Monday to Friday and do not include public holidays and weekends. The definition of a business day varies by region. It depends on the local work week which is dictated by local customs, religions, and business operations. For example, in the United States and much of the Western world, they are typically Monday to Friday. Within a few gulf countries the normal business days are Sunday to Thursday.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Day" type="tns:DayType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A day is a unit of time. Each day of the week is named in different languages after classical planets, various deities. In English, the names are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Indicator" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates if a given day is a business day or not.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BusinessHours" type="tns:TimePeriodType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Represents the business hours for a given business day. For example, 09:00 hrs - 17:00 hrs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of a business day.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ChannelPreferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Consent" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of whether the channel preference was given as consent by the consenter.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Channel" type="tns:ChannelPreferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The specific channel the preference applies to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Explicit" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of whether explicit permission has been given for the preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ExplicitThreshold" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The threshold value for the explicit permission/preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The period over which the preference is valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ChannelReferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CharacteristicsType"> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="characteristicName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the characteristic</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The building name, expressed as text, of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BuildingNumber" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The building number expressed as text, for this address. e.g. 38, 55a</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Country" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The country for this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="County" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of the county in which the city falls, where applicable</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Occupant" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The occupant at this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PostCode" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code specifying the post code of the address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PrimaryClassification" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary classification of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubLocality" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The sub locality of this address e.g district or borough</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubStreet" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The sub street of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubUnit" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The sub unit of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BuildingLetter" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The building letter of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TownSuffix" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The town suffic of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CountryCode" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ISO 3166-2 country code of this address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Type" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="StreetSuffix" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A modifier to a street name often to denote a relative direction</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="StreetType" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The kind of thoroughfare. Example alley, avenue, boulevard, crescent etc</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LevelNr" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The floor number within a building</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LevelType" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A description of the level within a building where numbers are not used</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PrivateStreetName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of a street with a site. Example Street within a university</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Portal" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The portal name of the apartment or flat</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PortalDoor" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The portal door number of the apartment or flat</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Characteristics" type="tns:CharacteristicsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PostalAddressWithLocationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Postal Address with a Geographic Location appended to capture both the address and the Latitude/Longitude.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:PostalAddressType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="LocationCoordinates" type="tns:GeographicLocationType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The geographic coordinates, the latitude and longitude, of the location.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IDs" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of Identifiers for the VBO or component. These should be used to uniquely identifier instances of the business object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier of the business object or component. This should be used to identify instances of a business object or component. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the primary key of the target object. Use the attributes @schemeName and @schemeAgencyName to identify type of Identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PreferenceReferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PreferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:PreferenceReferenceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Explicit" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of whether explicit permission has been given for the preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ConfidenceRating" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The rating as to the confidence held that the preference is correct.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ExplicitThreshold" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The threshold value for the explicit permission/preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PreferenceRoleType" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The role the preference should be applied to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InferredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The score given to the preference as inferred by Vodafone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VolunteeredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The score given to the preference as volunteered by the person providing the preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The period over which the preference is valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PreferencesType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Details" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Validity Period for the Customer Preferences</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Explicit" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Implicit/Explicit indicator for Customer Preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ConfidenceRating" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Confidence Rating</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Default" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Default Preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Instructions" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Instructions for the Customer Preferences</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InferredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Inferred score for the preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VolunteeredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Customer volunteered score for the preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="User" type="tns:UserType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="SubscribedService" type="tns:SubscribedServiceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PriceFrequencyType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="IntervalQuantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The interval between the time elements. The unit code must be set, e.g. "Day", "Month", etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IntervalsQuantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The number of time the interval between the time elements repeats.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IntervalUnitCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The interval unit code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PriceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountPercent" type="cct:PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount percent</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PriceTypeWithID"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier of the business object or component. This should be used to identify instances of a business object or component. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the "primary key" of the target object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountPercent" type="cct:PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount percent</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ProductCatalogueReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A list of ProductOfferings for sale, with prices and illustrations, for example in book form or on the web. ProductCatalogs can be used by Customers during a self-care ordering process and may be used across one or more DistributionChannels.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ProductOfferingReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The presentation of one or more Product Specifications to the marketplace for sale, rental, or lease for a Product Offering Price. A Product Offering may target one or more Market Segments, be included in one or more Product Catalogue, presented in support of one or more Product Strategies, and made available in one or more Places. Product Offering may represent a simple offering of a single Product Specification or could represent a bundling of one or more other Product Offering.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PublicEntityType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="DomesticUltimateBusinessName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary DUNS number of the organisation in its domestic market.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DUNSNumbers" type="tns:DUNSNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary DUNS number for an organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NumberOfEmployees" type="tns:NumberOfEmployeesType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total number of employees in the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OtherRegisterNumber" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An alternative registration number for the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PublicHolidayType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A public holiday, national holiday or legal holiday is a holiday generally established by law and is usually a non-working day during the year. The public holidays are generally days of celebration, like the anniversary of a significant historical event, or can be a religious celebration. Holidays can land on a specific day of the year, be tied to a certain day of the week in a certain month or follow other calendar systems like the Lunar Calendar.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Date" type="cct:DateType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date of the public holiday</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of the public holiday</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="RecurringAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An extension to the recurring amount to include type, description and reason.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:RecurringPriceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="DescriptionText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A description of the recurring amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TypeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type code for the recurring amount, identifies the type of one-off price, cost or charge. This can be used to indicate an OPEX or CAPEX amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReasonText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reason the recurring amount is required or has been incurred.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="RecurringPriceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:PriceTypeWithID"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Activation" type="tns:PriceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total one-off activation price. The currency must be set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Frequency" type="tns:PriceFrequencyType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The frequency at which the recurring price is applied</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NetAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The net amount for the recurring price</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax amount for the recurring price</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReferenceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="IDs" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of identifiers referencing the same associated artefact, document or content.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDTypePaktur" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Identifier of the reference. Ideally the reference ID should be a URL conforming to RFC3986.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SMSType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="TypeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type code of this SMS</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubscriberNumber" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The subscriber number e.g. 07765092245</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesAccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Type definition for the SalesAccount. A sales account is a representation of a potential customer (prospect) around which sales activity is focused.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesLeadReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A lead is the identification of an individual or organisation (Party) that has the interest and authority to purchase a product or service. This represents the first stage of a sales process. The identification of the lead is referred to as Lead Generation, a process conducted by either the marketing or sales organization. Thus, the Lead Entity in CIM is generated by the Lead Generation Interaction. This is a Party Interaction. The lead may have an organisation associated ( an Enterprise Sales Lead) with the individual(s). For potential Enterprise Customers, The lead is considered to be a role of Organisation since the Lead individual will not become a customer per se. The individual represents the company (Legal Entity) with which Vodafone hope to do business.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOpportunityReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An Opportunity is an opportunity to generate revenue from the account or lead. Opportunities are the pending deals that need to be tracked. Opportunities build the pipeline, which will contribute to the forecast.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Sales Order that was created from a Quote.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesPartnerAccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type definition for the sales partner account. Sales Partner Account is a special type of Partner Account that is used to manage the relationship with and activity of a Sales Partner</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SolutionOfferingReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Especially for Enterprise Customers, the product offering that forms the basis of the Quote will be customised for a specific customer. This Customised Offering is not the same as a Product although the final 'accepted' customised offering will be the specification for the product build. Customised Offerings may go through multiple versions before being accepted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SpecificationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A specification of the set of characteristics the define a particular object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CharacteristicsValue" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of characteristics for the specification.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:CharactersticsValueType"> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="characteristicName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the characteristic</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="StandingOrderPaymentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The period through which the bank account payment is valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="HolderName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the individual or organisation of the bank account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AccountNumber" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SortCode" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account sort code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IBAN" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account IBAN</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BIC" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account BIC code (SWIFT code)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="StatusHistoryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A history of the lifecycle state transistions of a VBO. Each transition records the date and time and should record the target lifecycle status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="StateTransition" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier or name for the state transition. Examples include: "Activate", "Cancel", "Complete", etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FromStatusCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The source lifecycle state of the transition, i.e. the state from which the transition is moving, for example: from "Active" to "Cancelled".</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ToStatusCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The target lifecycle state of the transition, i.e. the state to which the transition is moving, for example: from "Active" to "Cancelled".</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="EffectiveDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time of the transistion, i.e. the timestamp of when the target state was entered.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReasonCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The code describing why the transition occured.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReasonText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reason code describing why the transition occured</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubReasonCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Sub reason code describing why the transition occured.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubReasonText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The sub-reason code describing why the transition occured</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A description of the state transition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ChangedByUserID" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the User [Account] who initiated the lifecycle state transition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SubscribedServiceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TelephoneType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="PhoneType" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The phone type e.g. Landline, mobile</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubscriberNumber" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The subscriber number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LocalAreaCode" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Categories" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of classifications for the business object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Category" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="cct:CodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="listHierarchyID" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of the hierarchy level of the category when involved in a hierarchical classification, e.g. level 1 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=1, level 2 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=2. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Value" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The value of the characteristic. The repeating structure allows more than one value to be specified, these must be taken as an implict OR function, i.e. This Value-1 OR Value-2 OR Value-3.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="LogicalOperatorCode" type="tns:LogicalOperatorCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A field indicating how consecutive query expression should be evaluated, e.g. Condition-1 AND Condition-2.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="NegationIndicator" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indicator of whether the query expression should have a NOT applied to it, i.e. does NOT equal or is NOT less than.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="QueryOperatorCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:normalizedString"> <xsd:enumeration value="EQUALS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NOT_EQUALS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="GREATER_THAN"/> <xsd:enumeration value="GREATER_THAN_EQUALS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="LESS_THAN"/> <xsd:enumeration value="LESS_THAN_EQUALS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="CONTAINS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="DOES_NOT_CONTAIN"/> <xsd:enumeration value="LIKE"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NOT_LIKE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="QueryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A data object that allows simple and complex query criteria to be specified against which a set of business objects can be matched.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="StartIndex" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A field that supports the specification of pagination by a requester. The start index indicates the number of the instance matching the query criteria from which the page to be returned starts.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IndexPerPage" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A field that supports the specification of the size of the page to be returned in a query.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="Identification" type="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component within the query that specifies a specific instance of a business to retrieve. The ID specified represents the primary key of the business object as configured through the IDs/ID[/@schemeName=''] field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Criteria"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="QueryExpression"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated out of a series of value expressions (criteria).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="QueryExpression" type="tns:QueryExpressionType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated out of a series of value expressions (criteria).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ValueExpression" type="tns:ValueExpressionType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The value to be matched in a query criteria. The repeating structure allows more than one value to be specified, these must be taken as an implict OR function, i.e. This Value-1 OR Value-2 OR Value-3.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SortExpression" type="tns:SortExpressionType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component holding the specification of the sorting required on the query.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReportFieldType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A column (field) in the report lint item, either a field from the source VBO being part of the grouping expression or a calculated field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="Function" type="tns:AggregateFunctionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An aggregate function that allows statistics function to be specified for building the report</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Path" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The path to the field on which to make the calculation. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="Value" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The value of the source VBO field or the calculated value of an aggregate function.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReportItemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A specific line item in the report containing the result of aggregate function calculation on the given data set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Field" type="tns:ReportFieldType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A column (field) in the </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReportQueryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the details of the data set on which to report.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="QueryExpression" type="tns:QueryExpressionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated out of a series of value expressions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="GroupingExpression" type="tns:GroupingExpressionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A grouping expression that allows unique attribute from business object for the grouping to build report.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AggregateFunctions"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An aggregate function that allows statitics function to be specified for building the report</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Function" type="tns:AggregateFunctionType" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReportSpecType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A data object that allows report specification to be specified against various business objects for the calculation of aggregate functions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ReportQuery" type="tns:ReportQueryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the details of the data set on which to report.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReportType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>To provide a report on the statictics (aggregate functions) for a specific data set within the bounds of a business object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:ExtendedBaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ReportItems" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ReportItem" type="tns:ReportItemType" <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A route of communication and access enabling a customer or third party to obtain goods or information. Each Order Line can have a ShipTo and BillTo party reference. Each Order Line can have its own shipping and billing address which might be different from the actual Sales Order shipping and billing address. The price of individual Sales Order Line is captured at the Product Offering entity level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedSalesOrderPartsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderPriceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Type" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of charge. A Sales Order line item therefore will have a Create action for Product Offerings and a Delete or Modify action for Products, Resources and Services</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Schema Definition for Common Components across CSM Services</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType name="AccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type defining a reference to an Account, whether that be a Service Account, Loyalty Account or Product Stock.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ActorReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generic Actor type object used to name="AdjustmentPartsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type that supports the main body of an Adjustment business object. It supports both a direct credit or debit against an Account as well as a Balance Transfer from another Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Adjusts" type="tns:AccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Account to make the adjustment against. The sign of the Amount/Quantity is indicates whether this needs to be a Credit or Debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TransferFrom" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Account from which to transfer the Amount/Quantity from. The Amount/Quantity to transfer is held within the component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:AccountReferenceType"> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Amount to transfer from/to the Transfer Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Quantity" type="cct:QuantityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Quantity to transfer from/to the Transfer Account, if non-monetary values are required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TriggeredBy" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to another business object that triggered the Adjustment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:attribute name="businessObjectType" type="xsd:token"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of the business object being referenced, i.e. Advanced Shipment Notification or Sales Order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="AmountsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A definition of the costs associated with this feasibility request.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OneOffAmounts" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="OneOffAmount" type="tns:OneOffAmountType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecurringAmounts" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="RecurringAmount" type="tns:RecurringAmountType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> <xsd:element name="CompletedDate" type="cct:DateType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the approval was completed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ArtefactReferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="AttachmentType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="BinaryObject" type="cct:BinaryObjectType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Stores embedded base64 encoded data. Used to carry documents, images, etc. within the parent business object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Size" type="cct:MeasureType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The size in Bytes of the of the document or attachment. If this component contains the embedded data then the size is the size of the embedded data, if it is a reference without the data then it is the size of the referenced document.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Reference" type="tns:ReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to an external document.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="BusinessDayType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A business day is considered every official working day of the week. Another common term is working day. Typically, these are the days between and including Monday to Friday and do not include public holidays and weekends. The definition of a business day varies by region. It depends on the local work week which is dictated by local customs, religions, and business operations. For example, in the United States and much of the Western world, they are typically Monday to Friday. Within a few gulf countries the normal business days are Sunday to Thursday.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Day" type="tns:DayType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A day is a unit of time. Each day of the week is named in different languages after classical planets, various deities. In English, the names are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Indicator" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates if a given day is a business day or not.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BusinessHours" type="tns:TimePeriodType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Represents the business hours for a given business day. For example, 09:00 hrs - 17:00 hrs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of a business day.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ChannelPreferenceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Consent" </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Channel" type="tns:ChannelPreferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The specific channel the preference applies to.</xsd:documentation> for the preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ExplicitThreshold" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The threshold value for the explicit permission/preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The period over which the preference is valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> business name of the organisation used in their domestic market.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DUNSNumbers" type="tns:DUNSNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The DUNS number of the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NumberOfEmployees" type="tns:NumberOfEmployeesType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The number of employees the organisation employs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RegisteredNumber" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The registered number of the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Industry" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary industry in which the organisation operates.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubIndustry" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary sub-industry in which the organisation operates.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LegalParent" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The organisation that is legally the parent organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LocalTradingName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name under which the organisation trades locally.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OtherRegisterNumber" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An alternative registration number for the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VATRegistration" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Value Added Tax or similar Sales Tax identifier for the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MarketSegmentReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A grouping of Parties, Geographic Areas, Sales Channels, and so forth. Market Segments are the target of Marketing Campaigns, Product Offerings, Product Promotions, Product Placements, and Product Programs from both internal and external (Competitors, and other Providers) perspective.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MarketingCampaignReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Marketing Campaign is a coordinated series of steps that can include the promotion of a Product Offering through different mediums (television, radio, print, online) using a variety of different types of advertisements. The campaign doesn't have to rely solely on advertising. It can also include demonstrations, word of mouth and other interactive techniques.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MarketingPreferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Type definition of Customer Language Preference Reference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Confidence" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Confidence Rating</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InferredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Inferred score for the preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VolunteeredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Customer volunteered score for the preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="User" type="tns:UserType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="SubscribedService" type="tns:SubscribedServiceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MemberRoleType"> minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="BusinessGoals" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="DecisionCriteria" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="PersonalGoals" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MembersRoleType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Member" type="tns:MemberRoleType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="NoteType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Notes related to the entity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Content" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the note was created.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LastModifiedDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Last Modified time of the notes</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="NumberOfEmployeesType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Total" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total number of employees in an organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TeleSales" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The number of employees involved in tele-sales.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FieldSales" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A description of the one-off amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TypeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type code for the one-off amount, identifies the type of one-off price, cost or charge. The currency must be set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Installation" type="tns:PriceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total one-off installation price. The currency must be set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NetAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The net amount for the one-off price</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax amount for the one-off price</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="OrganisationPartyType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:PartyReferenceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="LocalTradingName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the organisation in its local area under which it trades. name="Type" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="StreetSuffix" Use the attributes @schemeName and @schemeAgencyName to identify type of Identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element>
