role the preference should be applied to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InferredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The score given to the preference as inferred by Vodafone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VolunteeredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The score given to the preference as volunteered by the person providing the preference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The period over which the preference is valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PreferencesType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Details" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Validity Period for the Customer Preferences</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Explicit" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Implicit/Explicit indicator for Customer Preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ConfidenceRating" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Confidence Rating</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Default" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Default Preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Instructions" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Instructions for the Customer Preferences</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InferredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Inferred score for the preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VolunteeredScore" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Customer volunteered score for the preference</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="User" type="tns:UserType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="SubscribedService" type="tns:SubscribedServiceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PriceFrequencyType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="IntervalQuantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The interval between the time elements. The unit code must be set, e.g. "Day", "Month", etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IntervalsQuantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The number of time the interval between the time elements repeats.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IntervalUnitCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The interval unit code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PriceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountPercent" type="cct:PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount percent</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PriceTypeWithID"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier of the business object or component. This should be used to identify instances of a business object or component. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the "primary key" of the target object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount Amount</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountPercent" type="cct:PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount percent</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ProductCatalogueReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A list of ProductOfferings for sale, with prices and illustrations, for example in book form or on the web. ProductCatalogs can be used by Customers during a self-care ordering process and may be used across one or more DistributionChannels.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ProductOfferingReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The presentation of one or more Product Specifications to the marketplace for sale, rental, or lease for a Product Offering Price. A Product Offering may target one or more Market Segments, be included in one or more Product Catalogue, presented in support of one or more Product Strategies, and made available in one or more Places. Product Offering may represent a simple offering of a single Product Specification or could represent a bundling of one or more other Product Offering.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PublicEntityType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="DomesticUltimateBusinessName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary DUNS number of the organisation in its domestic market.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DUNSNumbers" type="tns:DUNSNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The primary DUNS number for an organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NumberOfEmployees" type="tns:NumberOfEmployeesType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total number of employees in the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OtherRegisterNumber" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An alternative registration number for the organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PublicHolidayType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A public holiday, national holiday or legal holiday is a holiday generally established by law and is usually a non-working day during the year. The public holidays are generally days of celebration, like the anniversary of a significant historical event, or can be a religious celebration. Holidays can land on a specific day of the year, be tied to a certain day of the week in a certain month or follow other calendar systems like the Lunar Calendar.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Date" type="cct:DateType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date of the public holiday</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of the public holiday</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="RecurringAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An extension to the recurring amount to include type, description and reason.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:RecurringPriceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="DescriptionText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A description of the recurring amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TypeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type code for the recurring amount, identifies the type of one-off price, cost or charge. This can be used to indicate an OPEX or CAPEX amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReasonText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reason the recurring amount is required or has been incurred.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="RecurringPriceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:PriceTypeWithID"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Activation" type="tns:PriceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total one-off activation price. The currency must be set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Frequency" type="tns:PriceFrequencyType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The frequency at which the recurring price is applied</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NetAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The net amount for the recurring price</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax amount for the recurring price</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ReferenceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="IDs" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of identifiers referencing the same associated artefact, document or content.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDTypePaktur" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Identifier of the reference. Ideally the reference ID should be a URL conforming to RFC3986.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SMSType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="TypeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type code of this SMS</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubscriberNumber" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The subscriber number e.g. 07765092245</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesAccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Type definition for the SalesAccount. A sales account is a representation of a potential customer (prospect) around which sales activity is focused.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesLeadReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A lead is the identification of an individual or organisation (Party) that has the interest and authority to purchase a product or service. This represents the first stage of a sales process. The identification of the lead is referred to as Lead Generation, a process conducted by either the marketing or sales organization. Thus, the Lead Entity in CIM is generated by the Lead Generation Interaction. This is a Party Interaction. The lead may have an organisation associated ( an Enterprise Sales Lead) with the individual(s). For potential Enterprise Customers, The lead is considered to be a role of Organisation since the Lead individual will not become a customer per se. The individual represents the company (Legal Entity) with which Vodafone hope to do business.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOpportunityReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An Opportunity is an opportunity to generate revenue from the account or lead. Opportunities are the pending deals that need to be tracked. Opportunities build the pipeline, which will contribute to the forecast.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Sales Order that was created from a Quote.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesPartnerAccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type definition for the sales partner account. Sales Partner Account is a special type of Partner Account that is used to manage the relationship with and activity of a Sales Partner</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SolutionOfferingReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Especially for Enterprise Customers, the product offering that forms the basis of the Quote will be customised for a specific customer. This Customised Offering is not the same as a Product although the final 'accepted' customised offering will be the specification for the product build. Customised Offerings may go through multiple versions before being accepted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SpecificationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A specification of the set of characteristics the define a particular object.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CharacteristicsValue" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of characteristics for the specification.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:CharactersticsValueType"> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="characteristicName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the characteristic</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="StandingOrderPaymentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The period through which the bank account payment is valid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="HolderName" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the individual or organisation of the bank account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AccountNumber" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SortCode" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account sort code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IBAN" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account IBAN</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BIC" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The bank account BIC code (SWIFT code)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="StatusHistoryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A history of the lifecycle state transistions of a VBO. Each transition records the date and time and should record the target lifecycle status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="StateTransition" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ID" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier or name for the state transition. Examples include: "Activate", "Cancel", "Complete", etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FromStatusCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The source lifecycle state of the transition, i.e. the state from which the transition is moving, for example: from "Active" to "Cancelled".</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ToStatusCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The target lifecycle state of the transition, i.e. the state to which the transition is moving, for example: from "Active" to "Cancelled".</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="EffectiveDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time of the transistion, i.e. the timestamp of when the target state was entered.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReasonCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The code describing why the transition occured.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReasonText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reason code describing why the transition occured</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubReasonCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Sub reason code describing why the transition occured.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubReasonText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The sub-reason code describing why the transition occured</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A description of the state transition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ChangedByUserID" type="cct:IDType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the User [Account] who initiated the lifecycle state transition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SubscribedServiceType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TelephoneType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="PhoneType" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The phone type e.g. Landline, mobile</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubscriberNumber" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The subscriber number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LocalAreaCode" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The local area code for this telephone</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FullNumber" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The full number of this telephone</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TimePeriodType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="StartDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Start Datetime of the Time Period</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:choice> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Duration" type="cct:DurationType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Duration of the Time Period</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="EndDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>End Date Time of the Time Period</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TimingType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Timing definition</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="DayOfWeek" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>DayOfWeek for the Customer Preferences</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Timing" type="tns:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Timing for the Customer Preferences</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="tns:ActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="UserType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="ActionCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:normalizedString"> <xsd:enumeration value="ADD"/> <xsd:enumeration value="UPDATE"/> <xsd:enumeration value="DELETE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="AggregateFunctionCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:normalizedString"> <xsd:enumeration value="COUNT"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SUM"/> <xsd:enumeration value="MIN"/> <xsd:enumeration value="MAX"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="AggregateFunctionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An aggregate function that allows statistics function to be specified for building the report</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Name" type="tns:AggregateFunctionCodeType"/> <xsd:element name="Path" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The path to the field on which to make the calculation. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="BaseComponentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Base type for all business objects and some components.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:InfoComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Type" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A classification of the business object or component. This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Categories" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of classifications for the business object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Category" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="cct:CodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="listHierarchyID" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of the hierarchy level of the category when involved in a hierarchical classification, e.g. level 1 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=1, level 2 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=2. In this case the listName should be the same for each level to show their relationship.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Status" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The lifecycle state of the business object or component. This field is used to track the specific state an instance of an object or component is in, e.g. the Customer Bill is Active or the Customer Request has been Cancelled.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CharacteristicType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A characteristic, normally used through a Specification. This allows traits of the parent business object to be configured.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Name" type="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the characteristic. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Value" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The value of the characteristic. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="CollationAlgorithmCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The collation (sort) algorithm to use in the sorting to the result set</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:normalizedString"> <xsd:enumeration value="UTS#10"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="CountryCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code list restricting values to the ISO3166-Alpha 2 country codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="tns:ISO3166-1_Alpha2_CountryCodeType"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="EventCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:normalizedString"> <xsd:enumeration value="Created"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Updated"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Deleted"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="ExtendedBaseComponentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Extended Common base type for all Vodafone Objects. This also includes Status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="tns:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Version" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a business object or component. This field should be used in support of multi-agent environments to control the concurrency (locking) of the instance.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Created" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the business object or component was created. This is distinct from InteractionChannel which represents the physical media by which the CSP communicates with the parties (phone, email, fax, etc.)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FulfilmentOrders" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="FulfilmentOrder" type="tns:FulfilmentOrderType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Collection of Fulfilment Order associated with the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SalesQuote" type="tns:SalesQuoteType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Sales Quote is a price estimate (quote) or a presentation for sale (offer) of product offerings to a party playing the role of prospect or customer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ShipToContactPoint" type="tns:SalesOrderContactPointType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Ship to contact points</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TotalPrice" type="tns:SalesOrderPriceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total price of the Sales Order charged to the customer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LineItems" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="LineItem" type="tns:LineItemType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A single item on a Sales Order relating to one Product Offering, Product, Service or Resource. Each Order Line can have a ShipTo and BillTo party reference. Each Order Line can have its own shipping and billing address which might be different from the actual Sales Order shipping and billing address. The price of individual Sales Order Line is captured at the Product Offering entity level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedSalesOrderPartsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderPriceType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Type" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of charge. For example a one time charge, a recurring charge or a charge based on usage.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Text" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Texts that describe the price for different purposes</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FrequencyCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The frequency of the ProdOfferPriceCharge - relevant only for recurring charges. Example monthly,yearly,quarterly</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OriginalPrice" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The original price of the ProdOfferPriceCharge - before any adjustments or discounts.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FinalPrice" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The final price calculated after any adjustments or discounts for the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedPriceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderRolesType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Agents" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Agent" type="tns:AgentType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Agent for the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Requestor" type="tns:RequestorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Requestor for the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Customer" type="tns:CustomerType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Owner for the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BillToParty" type="tns:CommonPartyType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Bill to party for the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ShipToParty" type="tns:CommonPartyType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Ship To party for the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Subscriber" type="tns:SubscriberRoleType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Subscriber of the sales order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedSalesOrderRolesType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderVBOType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Sales Order is the mechanism allowing a customer to order products / services. These products and services are made available to the customer as Product Offerings. A Sales Order can also contain an order to stop a Subscription to an existing product or instructions to modify it in some way. Additionally, things like SIM swap, and service configuration changes may be included on a Sales Order. A Sales Order line item therefore will have a Create action for Product Offerings and a Delete or Modify action for Products, Resources and Services</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation>
